abstract: Independent investment banks Centerview Partners and Lazard served as sole advisers to Kraft and Heinz during talks resulting in merger that will create food and beverage conglomerate worth more than $75 billion; absence of big banks in deal reflects growing role boutique and independent investment banks are playing in large mergers and acquisitions.
lead_paragraph: Two independent firms — Centerview Partners and Lazard — served as the sole advisers to Kraft and Heinz.

headline.main: Biggest Banks Absent From Biggest Deal of Year
headline.print_headline: Big Banks Miss Out; Boutiques Seal Deal

snippet: Two independent firms — Centerview Partners and Lazard — served as the sole advisers to Kraft and Heinz.
